metadata.title: CVE-2017-9334 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An incorrect "pair?" check in the Scheme "length" procedure results in anunsafe pointer dereference in all CHICKEN Scheme versions prior to 4.13,which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service by passing animproper list to an application that calls "length" on it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9334` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.12.0-0.3
libchicken11 - 4.12.0-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.12.0-0.3').
